duck: Saurischia (from the Greek sauros (σαυρος) meaning 'lizard' and ischion (ισχιον) meaning 'hip joint') is one of the two basic divisions of dinosaurs.

wiki.text:
{{Automatic taxobox |name = Saurischians |fossil_range = Late Triassic—Present,
|image = Tyrannosaurus pelvis left.jpg |image_caption =
[[Tyrannosaurus|Tyrannosaurus rex]] saurischian pelvis and hind limbs (left
side). |authority = Seeley, 1888 |subdivision_ranks = Subgroups |subdivision =
*[[Spondylosoma]]?
* Herrerasauridae?
* 'Eusaurischia' ** [[Eoraptor]] ** Sauropodomorpha ** Theropoda
| synonyms =Harpagosauria <small>Haeckel, 1866</small>
}} 'Saurischia' ( , from the Greek sauros (σαυρος) meaning 'lizard' and ischion
(ισχιον) meaning 'hip joint')<ref>OED</ref> is one of the two basic divisions of
dinosaurs. In 1888, Harry Seeley classified dinosaurs into two orders, based on
their hip structure.<ref name="seeley1888">Seeley, H.G. (1888). "On the
classification of the fossil animals commonly named Dinosauria." Proceedings of
the Royal Society of London, '43': 165-171.</ref> Saurischians ('lizard-hipped')
are distinguished from the ornithischians ('bird-hipped') by retaining the
ancestral configuration of bones in the hip.

Sauropod and theropod dinosaurs fall under the class Saurischia. Orinthischia
(bird hipped dinosaurs) consists of Ceratopsian<nowiki/>s and dinosaurs such as
Parasaurolophus and Corythosaurus.

All carnivorous dinosaurs (the theropods) are saurischians, as are one of the
two primary lineages of herbivorous dinosaurs, the sauropodomorphs. At the end
of the Cretaceous Period, all saurischians except the birds became extinct. This
is referred to as the Cretaceous–Paleogene extinction event. Avians (modern
birds), as direct descendants of one group of theropod dinosaurs,<ref
name="padian2004"></ref> are a sub-clade of saurischian dinosaurs in
phylogenetic classification.
wiki.title: Saurischia
